DIF.Entry_Title: OMI/Aura DOAS Total Column Ozone 1-Orbit L2 Swath 13x24 km V003 (OMDOAO3) at GES DISC

Dataset_Citation.Dataset_Title: OMI/Aura Ozone (O3) DOAS Total Column 1-Orbit L2 Swath 13x24 km V003
Dataset_Citation.Dataset_Publisher: Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center (GES DISC)

Address.Street_Address: Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center

Data_Resolution.Horizontal_Resolution_Range: 10 km - < 50 km or approximately .09 degree - < .5 degree

DIF.Quality: This is the second public release of the version 003 OMI Level-2 Ozone product. Quality of the data has improved with the use of better ozone absorption coefficients and other minor changes.
DIF.Use_Constraints: This Data set (second public release of version-3 products) is better than the earlier version but it is not fully validated yet.

Organization_Name.Long_Name: Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center (formerly Goddard DAAC), Global Change Data Center, Earth Sciences Division, Science and Exploration Directorate, Goddard Space Flight Center, NASA

Contact_Person.Last_Name: GES DISC HELP DESK SUPPORT GROUP

Address.Street_Address: Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center

Summary.Abstract: The second release of Aura Ozone Monitoring Instrument (OMI) Version 003 OMI/Aura Level-2 Total Column Ozone Data Product OMDOAO3 is now available from the NASA Goddard Earth Sciences Data and Information Services Center (GES DISC) for the public access. The data were processed in late 2011 using Algorithm or PGE version 1.2.3 and released in March 2012.OMI provides two total column ozone products based on two different algorithms. This level-2 global total column ozone product at the pixel resolution (13x24 km at nadir), is based on the Differential Absorption Spectroscopy (DOAS) fitting technique that essentially uses the OMI UV radiance values between 331.1 and 336.1 nm. In addition to the total ozone column this product also contains auxiliary , derived and ancillary input parameters e.g. ozone slant column density, ozone ghost column density, air mass factor, scene reflectivity, radiance over the DOAS fit window, root mean square of DAOS fit, cloud fraction, cloud radiance, cloud pressure, terrain height, geolocation, viewing angles and quality flags. The shortname for this Level-2 OMI total column ozone product is OMDOAO3. The lead scientist for this product is Dr. J. Pepijn Veefkind.OMDOAO3 product files are stored in Hierarchical Data Format (HDF-EOS5). Each file contains data from the day lit portion of an orbit (approx 53 minutes) and is approximately 11 MB in size. There are approximately 14 orbits per day.

Related_URL.Description: Mirador is a data search interface that allows searching, browsing, and retrieving of Earth science data archived at NASA GES DISC.
Use the Simple Subset Wizard (SSW) to submit subset requests for data sets across multiple data centers from a single unified interface.
Use the Earthdata Search Client (EDSC) to find and retrieve data sets across multiple data centers.
Access the data via the OPeNDAP protocol
